replacements.replacement: // Initialize arrays A and B of length n with normalized index-based values to set up stencil initial conditions.
// Compute ceil(num/factor): the number of blocks needed to cover num items with 'factor' threads per block.
// 1D stencil compute kernel: uses grid/block/thread indices to process interior elements while skipping boundary points.
// Driver routine that runs tsteps stencil iterations, configuring grid/block sizes and launching the compute kernel each step.
// Print the n elements of array A with formatted output, inserting periodic line breaks for readability.
// Iterate i from 0 to n-1 to set A[i]=(i+2)/n and B[i]=(i+3)/n as increasing normalized values.
// Time-stepping loop: for each t, compute blocks for n elements at 256 threads/block and launch the stencil kernel.
// Traverse all n elements, printing each value and inserting a newline at regular intervals for formatting.
// Parse command-line args (dump flag, time steps, size) and allocate arrays A and B sized for n doubles.
// Compute the thread's global 1D index and guard work to interior indices (1 <= i <= n-2), skipping boundaries.
